title: Can - 17 albums
description:
Any fan of progressive/psychedelic/avant rock should have at least heard of these guys.  Combining elements of classically influenced "Musique Concrete", "Found Sound" or "Sampling" techniques (introduced by bassist/radio wave scanner Holger Czukay, LONG BEFORE Brian Eno who takes credit for introducing these elements to rock shame on him), modern classical chamber music, extended psychedelic jams, concise hard rocking tunes, jazz influenced improvisations with spoken word or beautifully melodic vocals.  In Can there was one of those "Once in a lifetime" coming together of people from extremely different backgrounds (Guitarist Michael Karoli from the rock scene, Drummer Jacki Liebezeit from the avant garde jazz scene, Keyboardist Irmin Schmidt from classical academia and an acomplished conductor in his own right, bassist Holger Czukay also from the acedemic classical scene who studied with Karlheinz Stockhausen, vocalists Malcolm Lowery, first vocalist who left in the early years, and Damo Suzuki, with Can the longest from the US and Japan respectively) that became a bubbling cauldron of genre defying collaboration that sounds relevant 30-odd years later.

The albums are:

Ege Bamyasi
Flow Motion
Future Days
Landed
Live Music 1971-1977 Disc 1
Live Music 1971-1977 Disc 2
Monster Movie (SACD) remasterd
Out Of Reach
Radio Waves
Rite Time
Sacrilege
Saw Delight
Soon Over Babaluma
Soundtracks
Tago Mago
The Peel Sessions
Unlimited Edition

Enjoy and Please seed!;-}

Junco
